paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant Val30Met, including penetrance data and patient demographics.

patients.demographics: Mean age 48.3 ± 5.6 years, 5 males and 7 females
patients.phenotype: Hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis with secondary glaucoma

individual_records.phenotype_details: Secondary glaucoma associated with ATTRv amyloidosis
individual_records.evidence_sentence: This study included 18 eyes of 12 patients with secondary glaucoma associated with ATTRv amyloidosis with an Val30Met mutation.

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met mutation in TTR is known to cause amyloid deposition leading to systemic and ocular complications.

variants.segregation_data: The Val30Met variant is known to segregate with disease in families affected by ATTRv amyloidosis.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the impact of the Val30Met mutation on secondary glaucoma.
key_quotes: All patients underwent liver transplantation at the mean age of 33.5 ± 5.9 years.
Ten eyes (56%) of eight patients were classified as surgical failures.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from the main text.
